channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for GA
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for GA

item.title: Report E-2024090464
item.description:
Report E-2024090464

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-23T09:15:38+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-17
  • City: LITHONIA
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: LANDSTAR INWAY, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 7500
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: On September 17, 2024, at 1141 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by Landstar personnel in Lithonia, Georgia regarding the release of NALCOÂ® BT-3011 BOILER WATER TREATMENT. Contractors were dispatched to the site to perform all onsite clean-up activities. Upon arrival, contractors confirmed the release of 260 gallons of Nalco BT-3011 Boiler Water Treatment (Sodium Hydroxide Solution, UN1824, 8, III) from (1) IBC plastic tote. The release was caused by a puncture and impacted the trailer floor, and multiple small areas of concrete as the trailer was in motion, that were unrecoverable. The residual material in the damaged tote was neutralized and solidified with absorbents, the damaged tote was cut up, then the trailer was neutralized and cleaned. Contractors also confirmed a 1ft x 6inch area of soil was impacted. Contractors were able to collect the impacted soil without complication. All waste was containerized in (4) 55-gallon DFs and taken offsite by contractors for proper disposal.
